definition: to wait a moment/do not go too soon
and/moreover/yet/for the time being/to be about to/both (... and...)
slow

sentences.english: Wait a minute, you may say.
But there’s still a long way to go.
sentences.chinese: 但是且慢，還有很長的路要走。

sentences.english: And if you think I've had faults, wait.
sentences.chinese: 如果你認爲我錯了，且慢斷定。

sentences.english: But wait, it seems that a minor confectionary revolution is afoot.
sentences.chinese: 且慢，似乎一場小規模的糖果革命正在進行。

definition: (said by departing guest) no need to see me out
to desist/to stop/to stay one's hand
wait a moment
stern voice
surname Hu
to neglect/to overlook/to ignore/suddenly
variant of 少安毋躁[shao3 an1 wu2 zao4]
cannot be used/must not (do sth)/unacceptable
(of yamen bailiffs etc) to walk ahead of an official, shouting at pedestrians to clear the way
to shout at sb to stop
keep calm, don't get excited/don't be impatient
variant of 少安毋躁[shao3 an1 wu2 zao4]
to be just about to/to be on the point of
shut up/shut your mouth/stop talking
to calm down/to quell one's anger
to wait a moment/later/in awhile
lit. your honored carriage/your highness/honored Sir (also sarcastic)/you
